Patch Set 10:

Hi All, 

Could you please review this patch and provide your comments/approval.

Thanks,
Kumar.

Patch Set 10:

(6 comments)

I partially reviewed this patchset, despite it claiming to just have moved code around, it seems to be making functional changes, moving things to globals, and other things.  I don't have the time to piece apart this patchset to figure out what's "new" and what's just being moved.  Please separate your code "moves" into a separate patchset from your additional features.

Patch Set 10:

(5 comments)

> Patch Set 10:
> 
> (6 comments)
> 
> I partially reviewed this patchset, despite it claiming to just have moved code around, it seems to be making functional changes, moving things to globals, and other things.  I don't have the time to piece apart this patchset to figure out what's "new" and what's just being moved.  Please separate your code "moves" into a separate patchset from your additional features.

As discussed Earlier, I split the Ipmb based Fru feature patch into two patches(1. Moving common code to FruUtils.cpp and 2.Ipmb related changes). This is first patch. I am just moving the common functions getFRUInfo, updateFRUProperty, addFruObjectToDbus from FruDevice.cpp to FruUtils.cpp. While moving functions, I had to move some variables to globals/.hpp files to make it common for other files. Created FruDeviceMain.cpp file to organize all the codes and make it easy for other Fru's implementation. 

Other than this, just fixed Magic number and hardcoded strings in FruDevice.cpp(we can skip these minor fixes now or move these minor fixes into separate minor patch)

Added new header files (FruDevice.cpp) and added functions declarations. Added functions declarations in FruUtils.cpp. Because of these changes, Stats shows the difference in number of lines.

Still, not submitted the patch no : 2( Ipmb related changes ). Once this patch get merged, I will submit this patch.

Patch Set 10:

> Patch Set 10:
> 
> (5 comments)
> 
> > Patch Set 10:
> > 
> > (6 comments)
> > 
> > I partially reviewed this patchset, despite it claiming to just have moved code around, it seems to be making functional changes, moving things to globals, and other things.  I don't have the time to piece apart this patchset to figure out what's "new" and what's just being moved.  Please separate your code "moves" into a separate patchset from your additional features.
> 
> As discussed Earlier, I split the Ipmb based Fru feature patch into two patches(1. Moving common code to FruUtils.cpp and 2.Ipmb related changes). This is first patch. I am just moving the common functions getFRUInfo, updateFRUProperty, addFruObjectToDbus from FruDevice.cpp to FruUtils.cpp. While moving functions, I had to move some variables to globals/.hpp files to make it common for other files. Created FruDeviceMain.cpp file to organize all the codes and make it easy for other Fru's implementation. 

I've pointed out things that are new in this patchset.   Please make sure that this is ONLY code moves.  New global scope variables have been created, which tells me that this is more than just code moves.

> 
> Other than this, just fixed Magic number and hardcoded strings in FruDevice.cpp(we can skip these minor fixes now or move these minor fixes into separate minor patch)

Yes, like I've said a couple times, please separate any sort of "fixes" no matter how minor into another patch.  This significantly helps reviewers to review this faster.

> 
> Added new header files (FruDevice.cpp) and added functions declarations. Added functions declarations in FruUtils.cpp. Because of these changes, Stats shows the difference in number of lines.
> 
> Still, not submitted the patch no : 2( Ipmb related changes ). Once this patch get merged, I will submit this patch.

That's fine.  I have no strong opinion on your ordering.

Build Successful 

https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/35403/ : SUCCESS
Please don't extern variables like this.  Rearrange the definitions and headers such that they're not required.

I'm not sure I'm comfortable with the number of things we're pulling into FruUtils here.  FruUtils is largely supposed to be inoccuous IPMI-FRU manipulation routines, this looks like we're pulling in a number of dbus things.  I suspect we need two Utils things, FruUtils, and FruDbusUtils?
Please don't extern variables like this.  Rearrange your code and headers such that it's not required.
These didn't exist in the old code, so please move to a separate patch for refactoring, and when you do, please use something that can be constexpr (generally const char[]).

This code looks like it was modified from the old version..... Doing this in a single commit makes the code very.....very hard to review.  Please move the code in one commit, then refactor in another.  I know this change is innocuous, but I'm not sure what other changes you've made now.
Considering this file didn't change (except for the addition of io_service) we shouldn't need to add 14 new includes.  Please do a scrub of this and only include what this file uses.
Can we use variable name instead of hardcoding ?
Can we use variable name instead of hardcoding ?
Just looking at the stats for this patch, it's adding 200 lines of code, that doesn't seem right considering this is just moving things around.  Were there additions as well?

Additional changes are not added in this patch. This patch just moves the common code to FruUtils to make use of the function by Ipmb based FruDevice deamon. For getting scope of the variables to all the .cpp files, had to move some variables to common files (global or .hpp).
This comment seems to have been ignored on the latest patch.

Ack. I wrapped/aligned commit msg in gerrit page itself in the latest patchset. In gerrit page text count is not showing. So, I missed to check the text count as 50/72.

I will update and make sure in the upcoming PS.
Please scrub this list.  A majority of these includes are not used in this file.  Please #include the headers in the files you use them, instead of putting them all in one place.
This comment seems to have been ignored on the latest patch.

Ack. I scrubbed the headers and removed unused header files in PS13 as per comment in PS10. I skipped the boost, sys, fcntl headers in PS13 as thought to used in the code. 

I will double check and ensure to remove the unused headers.
A number of these globals have moved from an cpp file to a hpp file.  That seems like an anti pattern.  Also, I don't think inline is appropriate here.

Actually, I moved addFruObjectToDbus function from FruDevice.cpp to FruUtils.cpp.  The variable "unknownBusObjectCount" used in the  both FruDevice.cpp and FruUtils.cpp files.

So, I moved the variable "unknownBusObjectCount" declaration from .cpp to .hpp file and made a lnline variable.

Since Entity-manager is not class based approach and it is method based approach. So, I used extern Earlier and you suggested to not use . So used inline variable now. 
Alternatively, I can think of use struct which has all the global variables, that struct should have const values only. 

Could you please suggest on this.

I suspect that it probably needs to be moved from being a global variable entirely now that we're going to be calling addFruObjectToDbus from multiple scopes.  Explicitly:

1. Remove the global variable from line 61 of FruDevice.cpp
2. Change line 1019 of FruDevice.cpp to be a variable declaration.  ie
size_t unknownBusObjectCount = 0;
3. Modify the addFruObjectToDbus method on line 641 to accept addFruObjectToDbus by a non-const reference.


This removes the need for the global entirely.  I suspect if you make this modification prior to doing your move, it will be easier for this case, given that you won't need to mess with global variables, but it's up to you which order you want to do it in.
Yes. These are new constexpr, I have used to avoid Magic number.
As stated earlier, please separate your cleanups from code moves.  it helps maintainers significantly to not have to sift through large patches that mostly contain already reviewed and correct code.
These definitions look new.  Also, please use something that doesn't require a construction on boot and can be made constexpr.  Generally const char* or string_view.

Ack. I wrapped the text in PS13 as per your comment in PS10. 
I will update and make sure, text count should be in 50/72 in Future.

Hi All,

Could you please review this patch and provide your comments if any.

Thanks,
Kumar.

Please help to review other peoples patches on master outside your immediate team, and as a result (if everyone does this) your patches will be reviewed faster.

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/q/commentby:Kumar+Thangavel+-owner:Kumar+Thangavel


Also, this patchset has been VERY difficult to review, because of the aforementioned mixing of logic changes with code moves.  Please work to make your patches easier to review in the future, and they will be reviewed and merged faster as a result.

Also, considering that your own team hasn't reviewed this patchset yet, ideally they'd be able to give you faster-turnaround feedback than the maintainers of this repo can (see first sentence about reviewing others code).
I went to review this, and comments left previously have been ignored.  Please don't ping maintainers for a re-review until you've addressed to responded to all the comments.

Hi All,

Could you please review this patch and provide your comments if any.

Thanks,
Kumar.

> I went to review this, and comments left previously have been ignored.  Please don't ping maintainers for a re-review until you've addressed to responded to all the comments.

Sure.

Agree. Thanks for your response and suggestions.

Sure. I will review other people patches also. 

I already split the some minor patches and that has been merged. I will look into split further small patches and make it easier to review.

Again, you're asking for reviews when the existing comments  that aren't under discussion (like wrapping your commit properly) haven't been addressed.  Address the comments that you know what to do on, then we can discuss anything you're confused on.

Actually, I didn't ask for review. I asked for review on Jan 31. In gerrit page, It is showing first comment on that comment thread. I think, that makes confusion.

I acknowledged your comment on Feb 1, and working on it. Also working on split this patch into small patches.
Just to confirm...are you still working on this patch Kumar?  If so, is there an ETA on when a new patch set will be submitted?
This is older patch. This patch was spilt into 3 small patches. 2 of them was already merged. one is in review. I will abandon this patch.
If this is being abstracted to a utility class, I don't think this can be a global anymore?
Ack. I will make it as local variable.

There's a lot of #includes being added here that I don't see used in this file. Just looking at it

<boost/algorithm/string/predicate.hpp>

and fcntl, inotify, and ioctl don't look used?
